description:
Engaging with Parents in Early Years Settings 
Authors: Dianne Jackson and Martin Needham
Published: 2014
Publisher: Sage
ISBN: 9781446258958 
Format: Retail PDF
__________________________________________________________________________

There are many services for children and many different settings in which care and education can take place.  Whether you work in childrenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s centres, outreach and dual-focused services, preschools, kindergartens or schools this book will help you develop the skills and strategies to work alongside parents whatever your role.

Focussing on:

The importance of involving parents
The nature of learning
How to engage and build relationships with parents
How to reflect on and develop shared learning environment in settings
Transitions and attachment
This book has examples taken from real settings and practical advice to help you put the ideas into practice. Reading and using it will help ensure the wellbeing and development of all children in your care.
